item.title: 巧克力股票将感受到可可价格飙升的影响
item.description: 今年可可价格的突然大幅上涨正在对全球巧克力股票造成影响，因为投资者正在争先恐后地评估如果主要原料的成本持续上升，糖果公司可能面临的影响。【原文：The sudden and sharp rise in cocoa prices this year is taking a toll on chocolate stocks across the world as investors scramble to assess the impact that confectionery companies could face if costs of the key ingredient remain elevated.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长帕内塔认为通胀 "快速 "下降导致减息时机临近
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员法比奥-帕内塔说，消费者价格增长正在迅速放缓，降低利率的时机正在临近。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said the growth in consumer prices is easing quickly and the time to lower interest rates is approaching.】

item.title: 德国失业率增幅低于预期，支持经济反弹
item.description: 德国 3 月份的失业率增幅低于预期；这进一步证明了劳动力市场的韧性，可能有助于支撑今年晚些时候经济的温和复苏。【原文：German unemployment rose less than expected in March — further evidence of labor-market resilience that may help underpin a modest economic recovery later this year.】

item.title: 胡塞武装发动袭击，俄罗斯海军进入军舰云集的红海
item.description: 国营塔斯社（Tass news agency）称，俄罗斯太平洋舰队的战舰已穿越曼德海峡（Bab-el-Mandeb Strait），进入红海。【原文：Russian warships from the Pacific Fleet have crossed the Bab-el-Mandeb Strait and entered the Red Sea, the state-run Tass news agency said, venturing into a maritime region plagued by Houthi attacks and crowded with naval vessels.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿达尼启动价值 12 亿美元的印度铜冶炼厂
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）斥资 12 亿美元建造的铜冶炼厂的第一套设备已经开始运行，这是这位富豪首次涉足金属精炼领域。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani has started operating the first unit of his $1.2 billion copper smelter, the tycoon’s first foray into metals refining.】

item.title: 劳合社称巴尔的摩大桥可能引发历史性海损
item.description: 伦敦劳合社首席执行官约翰-尼尔（John Neal）表示，本周二巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥倒塌事件的保险赔付额可能是有史以来海事保险中最大的。【原文：Insurance payouts for the Tuesday’s collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore could be among the largest ever in marine insurance, according to Lloyd’s of London Chief Executive Officer John Neal.】

item.title: 欧洲股市涨势扩大，将创一年来最佳季度表现
item.description: 欧洲股市有望创下一年来的最佳季度表现，投资者目前预计，由于对降息和经济增长持乐观态度，欧洲股市的涨势将超越该地区最大的公司。【原文：European stocks were on track for the best quarterly performance in a year, with investors now expecting the rally to broaden beyond the biggest companies in the region on optimism about interest rate cuts and economic growth.】

item.title: 英国央行哈斯克尔警告不要仓促降息
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者乔纳森-哈斯克尔在接受《金融时报》采访时表示，降息应该是 "很遥远的事情"。【原文：Bank of England rate setter Jonathan Haskel said interest-rate cuts should be “a long way off” in an interview with the Financial Times.】

item.title: 南非经济不温不火，高利率抑制信贷增长
item.description: 去年年底，在高利率、经济形势疲软和消费支出低迷的情况下，南非人的信贷意愿有所减弱。【原文：South African’s appetite for credit softened toward the end of last year amid high interest rates, weak economic conditions and muted consumer spending.】

item.title: 中国生猪存栏量减少将抑制对大豆和玉米的需求
item.description: 中国生猪存栏量的萎缩可能会抑制今年的饲料需求，从而影响大豆和玉米等用作动物饲料的主食的进口。【原文：China’s shrinking hog herd is likely to curb feed demand this year, affecting imports of staples like soybeans and corn used as animal fodder.】

item.title: 路透社报道：美国称药明康德向中国输送知识产权
item.description: 路透社援引未具名消息人士的话报道，美国情报官员今年 2 月告诉美国议员，药明康德公司未经许可向中国当局转让了一名客户的知识产权。【原文：US intelligence officials told American lawmakers in February that the pharmaceutical firm WuXi AppTec Co. transferred a client’s intellectual property to Chinese authorities without permission, Reuters reported, citing unnamed sources.】

item.title: 前日本央行行长白川方明怀疑上调利率标志着历史性转折
item.description: 前日本央行行长白川方明（Masaaki Shirakawa）对日本央行上周加息（17 年来首次加息）是否应被视为历史性转折表示怀疑。【原文：Former Bank of Japan Governor Masaaki Shirakawa voiced skepticism that the bank’s interest rate hike last week — the first in 17 years — should be regarded as a historic turn.】

item.title: 冰岛旅游业因物价上涨和火山爆发而受挫
item.description: 冰岛游客预订量的增长速度低于预期，高昂的物价和靠近居民区的频繁火山爆发令游客望而却步。【原文：Tourist bookings in Iceland are growing more slowly than forecast with travelers deterred by high prices and frequent volcanic eruptions near an inhabited area.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司本月无法从股东处获得 5 亿英镑资金
item.description: 泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water Utilities Ltd.）表示，扭亏为盈计划所需的首批 5 亿英镑新股本将无法如期在 3 月底前到位。【原文：Thames Water Utilities Ltd. said the first £500 million tranche of new equity needed for a turnaround plan will not be provided by the end of the March as anticipated.】

item.title: L Catterton 与前联合利华资深员工 Mehta 创办印度分公司
item.description: 由法国奢侈品集团路威酩轩-轩尼诗-路易威登集团（LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE）支持的 L Catterton 公司正在推出一种新的投资工具，用于投资印度消费领域的公司，以加强对世界上增长最快的主要经济体的关注。【原文：L Catterton, backed by French luxury group LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE, is launching a new vehicle to invest in Indian consumer-sector companies as it increases the focus on the fastest-growing major economy in the world.】

item.title: 随着中澳关系改善，中国取消对澳大利亚葡萄酒征收关税
item.description: 中国取消了对澳大利亚葡萄酒出口征收的惩罚性关税，这标志着对堪培拉长达三年的贸易施压运动宣告结束，也为这一价值数十亿美元的产业带来了复苏的希望。【原文：China lifted its punitive tariffs on Australia’s wine exports, signaling an end to a three-year campaign of trade pressure on Canberra and raising hopes for a revival of the billion-dollar industry.】

item.title: StanChart 预计流入印度债券的资金将增加 300 亿美元
item.description: 据渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）称，在印度于 6 月份开始被纳入一个主要的全球指数之后，印度的债券市场可能会有多达 300 亿美元的额外资金流入。【原文：India’s bond market will likely see an additional inflow of as much as $30 billion after the nation’s inclusion in a major global index starts in June, according to Standard Chartered Plc.】

item.title: 澳大利亚锂生产商为提高透明度将进行在线销售
item.description: 澳大利亚矿产资源有限公司（Mineral Resources Ltd.）将利用数字交易平台出售含锂矿物--锂辉石精矿，以提高市场透明度。【原文：Australian miner Mineral Resources Ltd. will use a digital trading platform to sell parcels of spodumene concentrate, a lithium-bearing mineral, in an effort to bring transparency to the market.】

item.title: 施瓦茨曼看好私人信贷，称违约率仅为 0.3
item.description: 黑石集团首席执行官 Steve Schwarzman 表示，即使批评者警告该资产类别出现泡沫，私人信贷行业仍将进一步扩张。【原文：Blackstone Chief Executive Officer Steve Schwarzman said the private credit industry will expand further even as critics warn of a bubble developing in the asset class.】

item.title: 习近平关于中国货币工具的旧讲话吸引交易员眼球
item.description: 在一本 172 页的书中，有一句话引用了习近平主席关于国家货币工具的评论，这句话迅速成为股票和债券交易员的热门话题。【原文：A line from a 172-page book citing President Xi Jinping’s comments on the nation’s monetary tools is quickly becoming a hot talking point among stock and bond traders.】

item.title: 阿达尼家族注资 7.99 亿美元，增持 Ambuja 水泥公司股份
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）及其家族注资 7.99 亿美元增持 Ambuja 水泥有限公司的股份，在印度基础设施建设蓬勃发展的背景下，这位商业大亨显示出对水泥业务的信心。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and his family injected $799 million to increase its stake in Ambuja Cements Ltd. as the business tycoon showed signs of confidence in its cement business amid the country’s infrastructure boom.】

item.title: 中国央行任命 2015 年以来首位女性副行长
item.description: 中国任命了九年来第一位女性央行副行长，这在习近平主席以男性为主导的政府中显得尤为突出。【原文：China appointed the first female deputy chief of the central bank in nine years, a hire that stands out in President Xi Jinping’s male-dominated administration.】

item.title: 假期前香港科技股领涨中概股
item.description: 周四，在香港上市的中国股票大涨，因为投资者在长周末前纷纷涌入权重科技股。【原文：Chinese stocks listed in Hong Kong rallied on Thursday as investors piled into heavyweight tech shares ahead of the long weekend.】

item.title: 对冲基金押注水泥 152，认为美元兑日元走势值得关注
item.description: 日元观察家们指出，1 美元兑 152 日元是受困货币的下一个关键水平，策略师们警告说，突破这一水平将为干预打开大门，而期权定位则有可能加速下跌。【原文：Yen watchers are pointing to 152 per dollar as the next key level for the beleaguered currency, with strategists warning that a breach opens the door to intervention while option positioning threatens to accelerate declines.】

item.title: 达里奥称中国必须解决债务问题 否则将面临 "失去的十年
item.description: 雷-达里奥警告说，中国应削减债务，放宽货币政策，否则将面临 "失去的十年"。【原文：Ray Dalio warned that China should cut its debt and ease monetary policy or face “a lost decade.”】

item.title: 股市熊市为何让人束手无策？
item.description:
对美国经济硬着陆的信念已经破灭。持怀疑态度的人现在可能会预测软着陆，但市场已经做好了不着陆的准备。【原文：

Belief in a hard landing in the US is over. Doubters may now predict a soft one, but markets are positioned for no landing at all.

】

item.title: 世界顶级铝生产商在几内亚面临原材料供应风险
item.description: 中国铝业股份有限公司（Aluminum Corp. of China Ltd.）表示，该公司认为几内亚铝土矿供应面临的风险 "相对较高"，这凸显出该公司在原材料方面对单一国家的依赖性日益增强。【原文：Aluminum Corp. of China Ltd. said it sees “relatively high” risks to supplies of bauxite from Guinea, highlighting its growing dependence on a single country for the raw material.】
